Microsoft posted adjusted earnings of $3.65 a share on revenue of $76.4 billion for the fiscal fourth quarter.

headline: Monolithic Power forecasts third-quarter revenue above estimates on AI demand
summary: Monolithic Power Systems forecast third-quarter revenue above estimates on Thursday, betting on strong demand for its power control products and semiconductors as generative artificial intelligence drives data center expansion. Shares of the Kirkland, Washington-based company rose nearly 5% in trading after the bell. The growing adoption of GenAI technology has helped drive demand for the hardware required to help run advanced data centers, helping providers such as Monolithic, which counts AI chip heavyweight Nvidia among its customers.

The growing adoption of GenAI technology has helped drive demand for the hardware required to help run advanced data centers, helping providers such as Monolithic, which counts AI chip heavyweight Nvidia among its customers.

Microsoft reported strong earnings growth and upbeat guidance after the market closed on Wednesday, with the stock reaching $4 trillion market cap in intraday trading Thursday.

headline: Nvidia Stock Hits a Record High After Microsoft, Meta’s Blowout Earnings. Here’s Why.
summary: Nvidia  stock hit a record high early Thursday after earnings from  Microsoft  and  Meta Platforms  reinforced expectations of continued investment in its artificial-intelligence chips.  Nvidia shares were up 1.3% at $181.65 in early trading, putting it on track to close above $180 for the first time, while the  had gained 0.8%.  Microsoft and Meta both underlined their commitment to spending on AI hardware in positive earnings reports late Wednesday.

headline: China Questions Nvidia H20 Chip Security, Summons Company for Talks
summary: China's cyberspace regulator summoned Nvidia (NVDA, Financials) to explain possible security risks in its H20 artificial intelligence chip, injecting new uncertainty into the U.S. chipmaker's China sales.  It also comes just weeks after the U.S. reversed an April ban on Nvidia selling the H20 in China.  Nvidia created the H20 specifically for the Chinese market after U.S. export curbs in 2023.

raw.headline: China Questions Nvidia H20 Chip Security, Summons Company for Talks
raw.summary: China's cyberspace regulator summoned Nvidia (NVDA, Financials) to explain possible security risks in its H20 artificial intelligence chip, injecting new uncertainty into the U.S. chipmaker's China sales.  It also comes just weeks after the U.S. reversed an April ban on Nvidia selling the H20 in China.  Nvidia created the H20 specifically for the Chinese market after U.S. export curbs in 2023.

Microsoft posted adjusted earnings of $3.65 a share on revenue of $76.4 billion for the fiscal fourth quarter.

headline: Trend Micro Reinvents Proactive Security with Digital Twin Technology
summary: Trend Micro Incorporated (TYO: 4704; TSE: 4704), a global cybersecurity leader, today unveiled a groundbreaking new cyber resilience model that reinvents how enterprises approach proactive security. Trend's Digital Twin capabilities will empower enterprises to simulate real-world cyber threats, validate their defenses, and adapt policies in real time across complex and diverse digital environments.

headline: Nvidia Stock Heads for Record High After Microsoft, Meta Blowout Earnings. Here’s Why.
summary: Nvidia  stock was heading for a new high early Thursday after earnings from  Microsoft  and  Meta Platforms  reinforced expectations of continued investment in its artificial-intelligence chips.  Nvidia shares were up 2.1% at $182.98 in premarket trading, putting it on track to close above $180 for the first time, while  futures had gained 0.9%.  Microsoft and Meta both underlined their commitment to spending on AI hardware in positive earnings reports late Wednesday, with plenty of that money expected to be used to purchase Nvidia processors.

Microsoft and Meta both underlined their commitment to spending on AI hardware in positive earnings reports late Wednesday, with plenty of that money expected to be used to purchase Nvidia processors.

headline: Wall St set to open higher as Meta, Microsoft results fan AI frenzy
summary: (Reuters) -Wall Street futures pointed to a strong start on Thursday, as blockbuster earnings from Meta and Microsoft signaled Big Tech's hefty artificial intelligence bets were paying off.  Meta Platforms soared 11.4% in premarket trading after the social media giant forecast third-quarter revenue well above estimates, thanks to AI boosting its core advertising business.  Microsoft issued a record capital spending outlook of $30 billion for the current quarter and reported higher-than-expected sales in its Azure cloud computing business.

Meta Platforms soared 11.4% in premarket trading after the social media giant forecast third-quarter revenue well above estimates, thanks to AI boosting its core advertising business.  Microsoft issued a record capital spending outlook of $30 billion for the current quarter and reported higher-than-expected sales in its Azure cloud computing business.

headline: Meta and Microsoft Keep Their License to Spend
summary: Meta Platforms  and  Microsoft  are both showing that obscene spending on new businesses can work—as long as the older ones are humming.  Meta’s  stock price in particular had slumped nearly 6% over the past month, following a flurry of news reports about Chief Executive  Mark Zuckerberg  lavishing nine-figure paydays on artificial-intelligence researchers.

headline: Arm sinks as chip ambitions, muted forecast shake investor confidence
summary: (Reuters) -Arm Holdings shares fell 7% in premarket trading on Thursday as the chip tech provider's plan to invest in its own chip development, which would bite into future profits, disappointed investors.  Arm’s decision to ramp up investment in chip creation marks a significant pivot from its legacy business model of licensing intellectual property to tech heavyweights like Nvidia and Amazon.com, companies that already design their own chips.  Potential conflicts of interest could arise as Arm's chip strategy positions it to compete with its own customers, said analysts at J.P. Morgan led by Harlan Sur.

raw.headline: Arm sinks as chip ambitions, muted forecast shake investor confidence
raw.summary: (Reuters) -Arm Holdings shares fell 7% in premarket trading on Thursday as the chip tech provider's plan to invest in its own chip development, which would bite into future profits, disappointed investors.  Arm’s decision to ramp up investment in chip creation marks a significant pivot from its legacy business model of licensing intellectual property to tech heavyweights like Nvidia and Amazon.com, companies that already design their own chips.  Potential conflicts of interest could arise as Arm's chip strategy positions it to compete with its own customers, said analysts at J.P. Morgan led by Harlan Sur.

headline: Qualcomm shares slide as Apple modem shift, tariffs raise growth concerns
summary: The San Diego-based chip supplier warned investors that Apple's move to depend on in-house modems, starting with the February launch of the iPhone 16e, would hit future chip revenue.  Qualcomm has intensified its focus on sectors such as data centers and personal computers.  Adding to the pressure, U.S. President Donald Trump's renewed tariff threats on semiconductors have emerged as a risk, potentially disrupting supply chains and hurting Qualcomm's handset revenue, analysts said.

raw.headline: Qualcomm shares slide as Apple modem shift, tariffs raise growth concerns
raw.summary: The San Diego-based chip supplier warned investors that Apple's move to depend on in-house modems, starting with the February launch of the iPhone 16e, would hit future chip revenue.  Qualcomm has intensified its focus on sectors such as data centers and personal computers.  Adding to the pressure, U.S. President Donald Trump's renewed tariff threats on semiconductors have emerged as a risk, potentially disrupting supply chains and hurting Qualcomm's handset revenue, analysts said.

headline: Big Tech may be breaking the bank for AI, but investors love it
summary: (Reuters) -Big Tech is spending more than ever on artificial intelligence - but the returns are rising too, and investors are buying in.  AI played a bigger role in driving demand across internet search, digital advertising and cloud computing in the April-June quarter, powering revenue growth at technology giants Microsoft, Meta, and Alphabet.  Betting that momentum will sustain, Microsoft and Alphabet decided to ramp up spending to ease capacity shortages that have limited their ability to meet soaring AI services demand, even after several quarters of multi-billion-dollar outlays.

Betting that momentum will sustain, Microsoft and Alphabet decided to ramp up spending to ease capacity shortages that have limited their ability to meet soaring AI services demand, even after several quarters of multi-billion-dollar outlays.

headline: China summons chip giant Nvidia over alleged security risks
summary: Chinese authorities summoned Nvidia representatives on Thursday to discuss "serious security issues" over some of its artificial intelligence chips, as the US tech giant finds itself entangled in trade tensions between Beijing and Washington.And Beijing's top internet regulator said Thursday it had summoned Nvidia representatives to discuss recently discovered "serious security issues" involving the H20.

headline: Aker and Nscale to build $1 billion OpenAI plant in Norway
summary: OSLO (Reuters) -Norway's Aker ASA said on Thursday it was partnering with Nscale Global Holdings and OpenAI to build a large artificial intelligence facility in northern Norway, aiming to install 100,000 Nvidia  processors by the end of 2026.  The partnership, called Stargate Norway, will be fully powered by renewable energy, Norwegian conglomerate Aker said in a joint statement with Nscale and OpenAI.  Aker ASA's shares rose 4.1% by 0715 GMT.

headline: Nscale, Aker and OpenAI to establish Stargate Norway: a 100,000 NVIDIA GPU AI Gigafactory powered by renewable energy in Northern Norway
summary: Nscale Global Holdings Ltd. ("Nscale"), Aker ASA ("Aker") and OpenAI today announced the launch of Stargate Norway: an advanced AI infrastructure project in Narvik, Northern Norway. Powered entirely by renewable energy, the facility will target to deliver 100,000 NVIDIA GPUs by the end of 2026, with ambitions to scale significantly in the years ahead.
